declarations.name: trpcClient
declarations.description: A tRPC client instance for the TRPCRouter, configured with httpBatchStreamLink and superjson transformer, using the URL from getUrl().

declarations.name: getContext
declarations.description: Returns an object containing the queryClient and tRPC serverHelpers, to be used as context for React components or hooks.
declarations.signature: function getContext(): { queryClient: QueryClient, trpc: typeof serverHelpers }
declarations.implementationNotes: Provides a convenient way to access both the query client and tRPC helpers in one object.

definition.name: Provider
definition.purpose: Provides tRPC and React Query context to the React component tree.
definition.description: A React component that wraps its children with TRPCProvider, supplying the trpcClient and queryClient instances for use throughout the application.

children.description: The child components to be rendered within the provider.

initial.data: No context is available before rendering.

when.description: The Provider is rendered in the React tree.

visible: Children components with tRPC and React Query context

effects: Children have access to tRPC and React Query context.

definition.visualLayout: Wraps children in a context provider.
definition.implementationNotes: Should be used at the root of the React app or at the top level where tRPC and React Query context is needed.
